metadata.title: CVE-2020-1735 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Ansible Engine when the fetch module is used. Anattacker could intercept the module, inject a new path, and then choose anew destination path on the controller node. All versions in 2.7.x, 2.8.xand 2.9.x branches are believed to be vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1735` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.9.7+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.7+dfsg-1').
